tags.name: amp-3d-gltf
tags.description: Displays GL Transmission Format (gITF) 3D models.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The src attribute specifies the gltf file location.

attributes.name: alpha
attributes.description: Use the alpha attribute to specify the behavior of the canvas background. This attribute takes a boolean value. To enable transparency instead of the default white, set the value to true.

attributes.name: antialiasing
attributes.description: Use the antialiasing attribute to specify whether to enable antialiasing. To enable antialiasing, set the value to true.

attributes.name: clearColor
attributes.description: The clearColor attribute specifies a CSS color, such as #FF8C00. This color fills free space on the canvas.

attributes.name: maxPixelRatio
attributes.description: The maxPixelRatio attribute specifies an upper limit for the pixelRatio render option. It defaults to window.devicePixelRatio.

attributes.name: autoRotate
attributes.description: Use the autoRotate attribute to enable automatic rotation around the model's center. To enable rotation, set the value to true. autorotate defaults to false.

attributes.name: enableZoom
attributes.description: Use the enableZoom attribute to disable zooming in and out of the model. To disable zoom, set the value to false. autororate defaults to true.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element. The default value is 'GLTF 3D model'.

tags.name: amp-3q-player
tags.description: Embeds videos from 3Q SDN.

attributes.name: data-id
attributes.description: The data-id attribute specifies the appropriate sdnPlayoutId from 3Q SDN.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: If the autoplay attribute is present, and the browser supports autoplay, the following behaviors are enabled:

attributes.name: Common attributes
attributes.description: The amp-3q-player component includes the common attributes that are extended to all AMP components.

tags.name: amp-access-poool
tags.description: Displays a Poool paywall.

attributes.description: Your App ID (you can find it on your Dashboard).

attributes.name: itemID
attributes.description: Your unique article ID.

attributes.name: pageType
attributes.description: Used to tell Poool that a page has been visited by the current user. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: Enable/disable debug mode. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: forceWidget
attributes.description: Override current widget for user. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: loginButtonEnabled
attributes.description: Enable/disable paywall 'login' button. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: signatureEnabled
attributes.description: Enable/disable paywall signature, shown under article content when the article has been unlocked. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: videoClient
attributes.description: Set default video client (vast, googima) for video widget. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: customSegment
attributes.description: Override native segments with a custom group/segment slug. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: cookiesEnabled
attributes.description: Following latest GDPR requirements, we decided to disable cookies by default inside our paywall. You will have to explicitly set this attribute to reflect the user's consent. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: Set default locale for all texts inside the paywall. See documentation for more information.

attributes.name: context
attributes.description: Override default or native contexts with a custom context value. See documentation for more information.

tags.name: amp-accordion
tags.description: A stacked list of headers that collapse or expand content sections with user interaction.

attributes.name: animate
attributes.description: Include the animate attribute in <amp-accordion> to add a 'roll down' animation when the content is expanded and 'roll up' animation when collapsed.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Apply the expanded attribute to a nested <section> to expand that section when the page loads.

attributes.name: expand-single-section
attributes.description: Allow only one section to expand at a time by applying the expand-single-section attribute to the <amp-accordion> element. This means if a user taps on a collapsed <section>, it will expand and collapse other expanded <section>'s.

tags.name: amp-action-macro
tags.description: Creates reusable actions.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Used to uniquely identify the action. This id is referenced in an action invocation.

attributes.name: execute
attributes.description: The action to invoke. Any valid amp action is allowed here.

attributes.name: arguments
attributes.description: Used to define arguments that can be used in the called invocation and substituted in the amp action macro call.

tags.name: amp-ad-exit
tags.description: Provides configurable behavior for ad exits for AMPHTML ads.

attributes.name: Id
attributes.description: An id is required so that amp-exit can be referenced by tappable elements.

tags.name: amp-ad
tags.description: A container to display an ad.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies an identifier for the ad network. The type attribute selects the template to use for the ad tag.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Use to denote that this is a sticky ad unit and specify the position of this unit. Its value must be one of:

attributes.name: data-foo-bar
attributes.description: Most ad networks require further configuration, which can be passed to the network by using HTML data– attributes. The parameter names are subject to standard data attribute dash to camel case conversion. For example, 'data-foo-bar' is send to the ad for configuration as 'fooBar'. See the documentation for the ad network on which attributes can be used.

attributes.name: data-vars-foo-bar
attributes.description: Attributes starting with data-vars– are reserved for amp-analytics vars.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Use this attribute to load a script tag for the specified ad network. This can be used for ad networks that require exactly a single script tag to be inserted in the page. The src value must have a prefix that is allow-listed for the specified ad network, and the value must use https protocol.

attributes.name: json
attributes.description: Use this attribute to pass a configuration to the ad as an arbitrarily complex JSON object. The object is passed to the ad as-is with no mangling done on the names.

attributes.name: data-consent-notification-id
attributes.description: If provided, requires confirming the amp-user-notification with the given HTML-id until the 'AMP client id' for the user (similar to a cookie) is passed to the ad. This means that ad rendering is delayed until the user confirms the notification.

attributes.name: data-loading-strategy
attributes.description: Instructs the ad to start loading when the ad is within the given number of viewports away from the current viewport. Without the data-loading-strategy attribute, the number is 3 by default. You can specify a float value in the range of [0, 3] (If the value is not specified the value is set to 1.25).

attributes.name: data-ad-container-id
attributes.description: Informs the ad of the container component id in the case of attempting to collapse. The container component must be an <amp-layout> component that's parent of the ad. When the data-ad-container-id is specified, and such a <amp-layout> container component is found, AMP runtime will try to collapse the container component instead of the ad component during no fill. This feature can be useful when an ad indicator is in presence.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element. The default value is 'Advertisement'.

attributes.name: common attributes
attributes.description: This element includes common attributes extended to AMP components.

tags.name: amp-addthis
tags.description: Displays AddThis customizable social share buttons.

attributes.name: data-pub-id
attributes.description: The AddThis publisher ID found in the URL in the AddThis dashboard after logging in.

attributes.name: data-widget-id
attributes.description: The AddThis widget ID for the tool to be displayed, also found on the AddThis dashboard.

attributes.name: data-widget-type
attributes.description: Attribute that describes the type of widget.

attributes.name: data-title
attributes.description: Optional. If set, this is the title that the AddThis tool will attempt to share when sharing occurs. If not set, the title of the document containing the amp-addthis tag will be used.

attributes.name: data-url
attributes.description: Optional. If set, this is the URL that the AddThis tool will attempt to share when sharing occurs. If not set, the location.href property of the document containing the amp-addthis tag will be used.

attributes.name: data-media
attributes.description: Optional. If set, this is an URL for a piece of media (e.g., image or video) that the AddThis tool will attempt to share when sharing occurs. If not set, this is left undefined.

attributes.name: data-description
attributes.description: Optional. If set, this is the description of the page that the AddThis tool will attempt to share when sharing occurs. If not set, this is left undefined.

tags.name: amp-analytics
tags.description: Captures analytics data from an AMP document.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of vendor. For details, see the list of Analytics vendors.

attributes.name: config
attributes.description: This is an optional attribute that can be used to load a configuration from a specified remote URL. The URL specified should use the HTTPS scheme. See also the data-include-credentials attribute below. The URL may include AMP URL vars. The response must follow the AMP CORS security guidelines.

attributes.name: data-credentials
attributes.description: If set to include, this turns on the ability to read and write cookies on the request specified via the config attribute. This is an optional attribute.

attributes.name: data-consent-notification-id
attributes.description: If provided, the page will not process analytics requests until an amp-user-notification with the given HTML element id is confirmed (accepted) by the user. This is an optional attribute.

tags.name: amp-anim
tags.description: Manages an animated image, typically a GIF.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the URL for a GIF image.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Provides a string of alternate text for accessibility purposes. Operates the same as the alt attribute on the img tag.

attributes.name: attribution
attributes.description: Indicates the attribution of the image.

attributes.name: attribution
attributes.description: Indicates the attribution of the image.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Provides the explicit size of the image.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Provides the explicit size of the image.

attributes.name: Common attributes
attributes.description: amp-anim includes the common attributes extended to AMP components.

tags.name: amp-animation
tags.description: Defines and displays an animation.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: Determines when the animation should be triggered. This must be set to visibility so the animation starts when a story page becomes visible and active.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Should always be nodisplay.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The id of the animation component. Used to reference the animation and chain a sequence of animations.

tags.name: amp-apester-media
tags.description: Displays an Apester smart unit.

attributes.name: data-apester-media-id
attributes.description: This attribute is required for single mode, and it represents the ID of the media (string value).

attributes.name: data-apester-channel-token
attributes.description: This attribute is required for playlist mode, and it represents the token of the channel (string value).

tags.name: amp-app-banner
tags.description: A wrapper and minimal UI for a cross-platform, fixed-position banner showing a call-to-action to install an app.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Defines a unique identifier for an amp-app-banner component. The id value is used for persistence logic.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Specifies the layout of the banner. The value must be nodisplay.

tags.name: amp-audio
tags.description: Replaces the HTML5 audio tag.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Required if no <source> children are present. Must be HTTPS.

attributes.name: preload
attributes.description: If present, sets the preload attribute in the html <audio> tag which specifies if the author thinks that the audio file should be loaded when the page loads.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: If present, the attribute implies that the audio will start playing as soon as it is ready.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: If present, the audio will automatically loop back to the start upon reaching the end.

attributes.name: muted
attributes.description: If present, will mute the audio by default.

attributes.name: controlsList
attributes.description: Same as controlsList attribute of HTML5 audio element.

attributes.name: Media Session Attributes
attributes.description: amp-audio implements the Media Session API enabling developers to specify more information about the audio file that is playing to be displayed in the notification center of user's devices (along with play/pause controls).

values.name: artwork
values.description: URL to a PNG/JPG/ICO image serving as the audio's artwork. If not present, the MediaSessionAPI Helper will use either the image field in the schema.org definition, the og:image or the website's favicon.

values.name: artist
values.description: (string) indicates the author of the audio.

values.name: album
values.description: (string) indicates the album the audio was taken from.

values.name: title
values.description: (string) part of the common attributes, doubles as the audio's name displayed in the MediaSession notification. If not provided, the MediaSessionAPI Helper will use either the aria-label attribute or fall back to the page's title.

tags.name: amp-auto-ads
tags.description: Dynamically injects ads into an AMP page by using a remotely-served configuration file.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: An identifier for the ad network.

attributes.name: data-foo-bar
attributes.description: Most ad networks require further configuration, which can be passed to the network by using HTML data– attributes. The parameter names are subject to standard data attribute dash to camel case conversion.

tags.name: amp-autocomplete
tags.description: Suggests completed results corresponding to the user input as they type into the input field.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The URL of the remote endpoint that returns the JSON that will be filtered and rendered within this amp-autocomplete. This must be a CORS HTTP service and the URL's protocol must be HTTPS. The endpoint must implement the requirements specified in the CORS Requests in AMP spec. If fetching the data at the src URL fails, the amp-autocomplete triggers a fallback. The src attribute may be omitted if the [src] attribute exists.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: The query parameter to generate a static remote endpoint that returns the JSON that will be filtered and rendered within this amp-autocomplete. This requires the presence of the src attribute.

attributes.name: min-characters
attributes.description: The min character length of a user input to provide results, default 1

attributes.name: max-items
attributes.description: The max specified number of items to suggest at once based on a user input, displays all if unspecified

attributes.name: suggest-first
attributes.description: Suggest the first entry in the list of results by marking it active.

attributes.name: submit-on-enter
attributes.description: The enter key is primarily used for selecting suggestions in autocomplete, so it shouldn’t also submit the form unless the developer explicitly sets it to do so (for search fields/one field forms, et cetera).

attributes.name: highlight-user-entry
attributes.description: If present, exposes the autocomplete-partial class on the substring within the suggested item that resulted in its match with the user input. This can be used to stylize the corresponding match to stand out to the user. Defaults to false.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: Specifies the key to the data array within the JSON response. Nested keys can be expressed with a dot-notated value such as field1.field2.

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Whether the amp-autocomplete should autosuggest on the full user input or only a triggered substring of the user input.

attributes.name: prefetch
attributes.description: Include the prefetch attribute to prefetch remote data to improve responsiveness for users. Requires src to be specified.

tags.name: amp-base-carousel
tags.description: Displays multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis or vertical axis.

attributes.name: Media Queries
attributes.description: The attributes for <amp-base-carousel> can be configured to use different options based on a media query.

tags.name: amp-beopinion
tags.description: Embeds BeOpinion content.

attributes.name: data-account
attributes.description: The ID of the BeOpinion account (page owner).

attributes.name: data-content
attributes.description: The ID of the BeOpinion content to be displayed on the page.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element.

tags.name: amp-bodymovin-animation
tags.description: Displays an AirBnB Bodymovin animation player.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The path to the exported Bodymovin animation object. Must be https protocol.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Indicates whether the animation should be looping or not.

attributes.name: noautoplay
attributes.description: By default, an animation autoplays. If this attribute is added the video waits for an action to start playing.

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description: Multiple renderers are supported and can be specified:

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element.

tags.name: amp-byside-content
tags.description: Displays dynamic content from the BySide service.

attributes.name: data-webcare-id
attributes.description: The BySide customer account ID.

attributes.name: data-label
attributes.description: The content label as seen in your BySide account.

attributes.name: data-webcare-zone
attributes.description: The webcare zone property, as specified in the BySide customer account geographic zone.

attributes.name: data-lang
attributes.description: The language to show the contents in, as specified in the BySide customer account localization.

attributes.name: data-channel
attributes.description: The channel identifier to use for content validation. Defaults to an empty string.

attributes.name: data-fid
attributes.description: The visitor force id. Use this when a unique visitor identifier is available, usually for authenticated users. Defaults to an empty string.

tags.name: amp-call-tracking
tags.description: Dynamically replaces a phone number in a hyperlink to enable call tracking.

attributes.name: config
attributes.description: Defines a CORS URL. The URL's protocol must be HTTPS. The response must consist of a valid JSON object with the following fields:

values.name: phoneNumber
values.description: Specifies the phone number to call when the user clicks the link.

values.name: formattedPhoneNumber
values.description: Specifies the phone number to display. If not specified, the value in phoneNumber is used.

tags.name: amp-carousel
tags.description: Displays multiple similar pieces of content along a horizontal axis.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies the display type for the carousel items, which can be:

values.name: carousel
values.description: All slides are shown and are scrollable horizontally. Each slide may specify a different width using CSS.

values.name: slides
values.description: Shows a single slide at a time, with each slide snapping into place as the user swipes.

attributes.name: controls
attributes.description: Permanently displays left and right arrows for the user to navigate carousel items on mobile devices.

attributes.name: data-next-button-aria-label
attributes.description: Sets the aria-label for the amp-carousel-button-next. If no value is given, the aria-label defaults to 'Next item in carousel'.

attributes.name: data-prev-button-aria-label
attributes.description: Sets the aria-label for the amp-carousel-button-prev. If no value is given, the aria-label defaults to 'Previous item in carousel'.

attributes.name: data-button-count-format
attributes.description: A format string that looks like (%s of %s), used as a suffix to the aria-label for amp-carousel-button-next amp-carousel-button-prev. This provides information to users using a screen reader on their progress through the carousel. If no value is given, this defaults to (%s of %s).

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: Regularly advances to the next slide without user interaction. If the user manually changes slides, then autoplay is stopped.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: Specifies the duration (in milliseconds) to delay advancing to the next slide when autoplay is enabled. Note that the minimum allowed value for delay is 1000 milliseconds.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Allows the user to advance past the first item or the final item. There must be at least 3 slides for looping to occur.

attributes.name: slide
attributes.description: Specifies what index should be shown when the carousel is first rendered. This can be updated with amp-bind to change which index is shown.

tags.name: amp-connatix-player
tags.description: Displays a cloud-hosted Connatix Player.

attributes.name: data-player-id
attributes.description: Connatix media id. This represents the unique ID of any media in your Library. This can be found at the Library section in the Connatix management dashboard.

attributes.name: data-param-*
attributes.description: All data-param-* prefixed attributes are turned into URL parameters and passed to iframe src.

attributes.name: dock
attributes.description: Requires amp-video-docking extension. If this attribute is present and the video is playing manually, the video will be 'minimized' and fixed to a corner or an element when the user scrolls out of the video component's visual area. For more details, see documentation on the docking extension itself.

tags.name: amp-dailymotion
tags.description: Displays a Dailymotion video.

attributes.name: play
attributes.description: Plays the video.

attributes.name: pause
attributes.description: Pauses the video.

attributes.name: mute
attributes.description: Mutes the video.

attributes.name: unmute
attributes.description: Unmutes the video.

attributes.name: fullscreenenter
attributes.description: Takes the video to fullscreen.

tags.name: amp-date-countdown
tags.description: Displays a countdown sequence to a specified date.

attributes.name: end-dateend-date
attributes.description: An ISO formatted date to count down to.

attributes.name: timestamp-ms
attributes.description: A POSIX epoch value in milliseconds; assumed to be UTC timezone.

attributes.name: timestamp-seconds
attributes.description: A POSIX epoch value in seconds; assumed to be UTC timezone.

attributes.name: timeleft-ms
attributes.description: A value in milliseconds left to be counting down.

attributes.name: timeleft-ms
attributes.description: A value in milliseconds left to be counting down.

attributes.name: offset-seconds
attributes.description: A positive or negative number that represents the number of seconds to add or subtract from the end-date.

attributes.name: when-ended
attributes.description: Specifies whether to stop the timer when it reaches 0 seconds. The value can be set to stop (default) to indicate the timer to stop at 0 seconds and will not pass the final date or continue to indicate the timer should continue after reaching 0 seconds.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: An internationalization language string for each timer unit. The default value is en (for English).

attributes.name: biggest-unit
attributes.description: Allows the amp-date-countdown component to calculate the time difference based on the specified biggest-unit value.

attributes.name: data-count-up
attributes.description: Include this attribute to reverse the direction of the countdown to count up instead. This is useful to display the time elapsed since a target date in the past. To continue the countdown when the target date is in the past, be sure to include the when-ended attribute with the continue value. If the target date is in the future, amp-date-countdown will display a decrementing (toward 0) negative value.

tags.name: amp-date-display
tags.description: The amp-date-display component displays time data that you can render in your AMP page.

attributes.name: datetime
attributes.description: The datetime attribute specifies the date and time in a standard ISO 8601 date string (e.g. 2017-08-02T15:05:05.000Z) or the string now. If set to now, amp-date-display will use the time the page loaded to render its template.

attributes.name: timestamp-ms
attributes.description: The timestamp-ms attribute specifies the date and time using the number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01T0:00:00.000Z

attributes.name: timestamp-seconds
attributes.description: The timestamp-seconds attribute specifies the date and time using the number of seconds since 1970-01-01T0:00:00.000Z

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: An internationalization language string for each timer unit. The default value is en (for English). This attribute supports all values that are supported by the user's browser.

attributes.name: display-in
attributes.description: If set to the value utc, the display-in attribute will convert the given date to UTC.

attributes.name: offset-seconds
attributes.description: The offset-seconds attribute specifies an integer number of seconds to shift the given date.

attributes.name: data-options-*
attributes.description: The data-options-* supports all the options under Intl.DateTimeFormat.options parameter that specifies the formatting style to use for localeString format. Valid attributes include: data-options-date-style, data-options-time-style, etc.

tags.name: amp-date-picker
tags.description: Provides a widget to select dates. The date picker can render as an overlay relative to input fields, or as a static calendar widget.

attributes.name: clear
attributes.description: The clear action clears the date value or values from the single date picker or date range picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker.

attributes.name: setDate
attributes.description: The setDate action assigns the value of the date argument to the single date picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker.

attributes.name: setDates
attributes.description: The setDate action assigns the value of the start and end arguments to the date range picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker.

attributes.name: today
attributes.description: The today action assigns the value of the current day, plus an offset argument, to the single date picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker. The offset argument value can be any integer.

attributes.name: startToday
attributes.description: The startToday action assigns the value of the current day, plus an offset argument, to the date range picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker. The offset argument value can be any integer.

attributes.name: endToday
attributes.description: The endToday action assigns the value of the current day, plus an offset argument, to the date range picker with the specified id, e.g. date-picker. The offset argument value can be any integer.

tags.name: amp-delight-player
tags.description: The amp-delight-player element displays a cloud-hosted Delight Player.

attributes.name: data-content-id
attributes.description: The video's content ID.

attributes.name: dock
attributes.description: Requires amp-video-docking extension. If this attribute is present and the video is playing manually, the video will be 'minimized' and fixed to a corner or an element when the user scrolls out of the video component's visual area.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: If this attribute is present, and the browser supports autoplay, the video will be automatically played as soon as it becomes visible. There are some conditions that the component needs to meet to be played, which are outlined in the Video in AMP spec.

tags.name: amp-embedly-card
tags.description: Displays an Embedly card.

attributes.name: data-url
attributes.description: The URL to retrieve embedding information.

attributes.name: data-card-embed
attributes.description: The URL to a video or rich media. Use with static embeds like articles, instead of using the static page content in the card, the card will embed the video or rich media.

attributes.name: data-card-image
attributes.description: The URL to an image. Specifies which image to use in article cards when data-url points to an article. Not all image URLs are supported, if the image is not loaded, try a different image or domain.

attributes.name: data-card-controls
attributes.description: Enables share icons.

attributes.name: data-card-align
attributes.description: Aligns the card. The possible values are left, center and right. The default value is center.

attributes.name: data-card-recommend
attributes.description: When recommendations are supported, it disables embedly recommendations on video and rich cards. These are recommendations created by embedly.

attributes.name: data-card-via
attributes.description: Specifies the via content in the card. This is a great way to do attribution.

attributes.name: data-card-theme
attributes.description: Allows settings the dark theme which changes the background color of the main card container. Use dark to set this theme. For dark backgrounds it's better to specify this. The default is light, which sets no background color of the main card container.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element. The default value is 'Embedly card'.

tags.name: amp-facebook-comments
tags.description: Embeds the Facebook comments plugin.

attributes.name: data-href
attributes.description: The URL of the comments page. For example, http://www.directlyrics.com/adele-25-complete-album-lyrics-news.html.

attributes.name: data-locale
attributes.description: By default, the locale is set to user's system language; however, you can specify a locale as well.

attributes.name: data-numposts
attributes.description: The number of comments to show. Currently Facebook SDK limits this to max 100.

attributes.name: data-order-by
attributes.description: The order to use when displaying comments.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying element. The default value is .title<iframe>'Facebook comments'

tags.name: amp-facebook-like
tags.description: Embeds the Facebook like button plugin.

attributes.name: data-href
attributes.description: The absolute URL of the page that will be liked.

attributes.name: data-locale
attributes.description: By default, the locale is set to user's system language; however, you can specify a locale as well.

attributes.name: data-action
attributes.description: The verb to display on the button. Can be either like or recommend. The default is like.

attributes.name: data-colorscheme
attributes.description: The color scheme used by the plugin for any text outside of the button itsel

attributes.name: data-kd_site
attributes.description: This attribute is also known as data-kid_directed_site in the Facebook SDK. If your web site or online service, or a portion of your service, is directed to children under 13 you must enable this attribute.

attributes.name: data-layout
attributes.description: Selects one of the different layouts that are available for the plugin. Can be one of standard, button_count, button or box_count.

attributes.name: data-ref
attributes.description: A label for tracking referrals which must be less than 50 characters and can contain alphanumeric characters and some punctuation.

attributes.name: data-share
attributes.description: Specifies whether to include a share button beside the Like button. This only works with the XFBML version.

attributes.name: data-show_faces
attributes.description: Specifies whether to display profile photos below the button (standard layout only). You must not enable this on child-directed sites.

attributes.name: data-size
attributes.description: The size of the button, which can be one of two sizes

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element.

tags.name: amp-fit-text

tags.name: amp-font
tags.description: Trigger and monitor the loading of custom fonts on AMP pages.

attributes.name: font-family
attributes.description: The font family of the custom loaded font.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The allowed time in millisecond for the custom font to load. Defaults to 3000 when undefined. When set to 0 the component loads font only if the font is in the cache. If set to an invalid value it defaults back to 3000.

attributes.name: on-load-add-class
attributes.description: CSS class to add to document root after custom font is available.

attributes.name: on-load-remove-class
attributes.description: CSS class to remove from document root after custom font is available.

attributes.name: on-error-add-class
attributes.description: CSS class to add to the document root if the timeout interval runs out before the font is available.

attributes.name: on-error-remove-class
attributes.description: CSS class to remove from document root if the timeout interval runs out before the font is available.

attributes.name: font-weight
attributes.description: Behaves same as standard CSS font-weight property.

attributes.name: font-style
attributes.description: Behaves same as standard CSS font-style property.

attributes.name: font-variant
attributes.description: Behaves same as standard CSS font-variant property.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: The layout attribute must be set to nodisplay.

attributes.name: Other form attributes

attributes.name: noautoplay

attributes.name: data-tracking-ids
attributes.description: The list of the Google Analytics tracking IDs to send the player metrics to (comma separated).

attributes.name: data-voice
attributes.description: The voice to use for generating the Text-to-Speech audio. Publishers should use only a single voice and only from the supported voices list (TBD).

attributes.name: data-url
attributes.description: The canonical URL of the web page to read aloud. The URL must be publicly accessible and free of any PII. The URL must be on a domain that was configured by Google and correlated with the specific API key.

attributes.name: data-speakable
attributes.description: Controls the contents to read aloud.

attributes.name: data-call-to-action-label
attributes.description: The call to action label that is shown before the user pressed on play for the first time.

attributes.name: data-intro
attributes.description: The URL of the MP3 audio file which will be played before the player starts reading from the beginning.

attributes.name: data-outro
attributes.description: The URL of the MP3 audio file which will be played after the player ends reading.

attributes.name: data-ad-tag-url
attributes.description: A complete VAST ad tag URL with parameters for playing pre-roll audio ads. When present, audio ads will be played before reading aloud page contents, after the user clicks on the play button for the first time.

attributes.description: These attributes should all behave like they do on standard iframes.

tags.name: amp-iframely
tags.description: Displays Iframely.com-powered rich media embeds

attributes.name: Indentifying
attributes.description: There are two ways to identify rich media. Either with the help of Iframely-issued ID, or with a pair of media URL and your API key.

values.name: data-url
values.description: Alternatively, if no content ID, identify rich media by its canonical URL.

values.name: data-key
values.description: If data-url is used, also add the MD5 hash of your Iframely API key as data-key attribute. Hash your key, the unencrypted value won't work here.

attributes.name: Placing
attributes.description: amp-iframely supports responsive and fixed-height layouts:

values.name: width
values.description: Use both attributes for responsive media to define its aspect-ratio. Use only height for a fixed-height layout. If you don't have media sizes - use what works best as a placeholder, and add resizable as below.

values.name: height
values.description: Use both attributes for responsive media to define its aspect-ratio. Use only height for a fixed-height layout. If you don't have media sizes - use what works best as a placeholder, and add resizable as below.

values.name: resizable
values.description: A flag to add event listener and adjust component's height automatically to fit and match the rich media content. This works with both responsive and fixed-height layouts.

values.name: data-img
values.description: Empty attribute, indicating that rich media's thumbnail image should be used as a placeholder while the component and its content loads.

tags.name: amp-ima-video
tags.description: Embeds a video player for instream video ads that are integrated with the IMA SDK.

attributes.name: data-tag
attributes.description: The URL for your VAST ad document. A relative URL or a URL that uses https protocol.

attributes.name: data-src
attributes.description: The URL of your video content. A relative URL or a URL that uses https protocol. This attribute is required if no <source> children are present.

attributes.name: data-crossorigin
attributes.description: Required if a track resource is hosted on a different origin than the document.

attributes.name: data-poster
attributes.description: An image for the frame to be displayed before video playback has started. By default, the first frame is displayed.

attributes.name: data-delay-ad-request
attributes.description: If true, delay the ad request until either the user scrolls the page, or for 3 seconds, whichever occurs first. Defaults to false.

attributes.name: data-ad-label
attributes.description: A format string that looks like 'Ad (%s of %s)', used to generate the ad disclosure when an ad is playing.

attributes.name: dock
attributes.description: Requires amp-video-docking extension. If this attribute is present and the video is playing manually, the video will be 'minimized' and fixed to a corner or an element when the user scrolls out of the video component's visual area. For more details, see documentation on the docking extension itself.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Define a title attribute for the component to propagate to the underlying <iframe> element. The default value is 'IMA video'.

tags.name: amp-image-lightbox

attributes.name: data-close-button-aria-label

tags.name: amp-image-slider

attributes.name: disable-hint-reappear
attributes.description: The hints that shows at the center of the vertical bar will disappear once the user starts interacting with the slider (such as clicking the mouse button, touch the slider, and pressing keys to move the slider).

attributes.name: initial-slider-position
attributes.description: The vertical slider bar sits at the center of the slider body by default.

attributes.name: step-size
attributes.description: When focusing on the slider, left and right keyboard buttons move the slider bar by 10% each press. To use a different step size, set step-size to a value between 0 and 1, corresponding to moving 0% to moving 100% each key press.

tags.name: amp-img
tags.description: Replaces the HTML5 img tag.

attributes.name: sizes
attributes.description: The value of the AMP sizes attribute is a sizes expression that selects the defined size corresponding to the media query based on the current window size.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: A string of alternate text, similar to the alt attribute on img.

attributes.name: attribution
attributes.description: A string that indicates the attribution of the image. For example, attribution='CC courtesy of Cats on Flicker'.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: An explicit size of the image, which is used by the AMP runtime to determine the aspect ratio without fetching the image.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: An explicit size of the image, which is used by the AMP runtime to determine the aspect ratio without fetching the image.

tags.name: amp-inputmask
tags.description: Provides input masking capabilities to inputs in AMP forms

attributes.name: mask
attributes.description: Specifies the mask or masks to apply to the input element.

values.name: L
values.description: The user must add an alphabetical character
The user must add a numeric character

values.name: A
values.description: The user must add an alphanumeric character

values.name: C
values.description: The user must add an arbitrary character

values.name: l
values.description: The user may optionally add an alphabetical character

values.name: a
values.description: The user may optionally add an alphanumeric character

values.name: c
values.description: The user may optionally add an arbitrary character
The user may optionally add a numeric character.
The backslash " escapes the next character in the mask to be a character literal.
The user must add an alphabetical character

attributes.name: mask-trim-zeros
attributes.description: Specifies how many zeros the mask will remove from pasted values into custom masks. For backwards compatibility, the default is 2. Specify 0 to disable this behavior.

attributes.name: mask-output
attributes.description: Specifies how the form will submit the input value.

values.name: raw
values.description: Outputs the value as-is with all special characters.

values.name: alphanumeric
values.description: Only outputs alphanumeric characters in the mask.

tags.name: amp-install-serviceworker

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The URL of the ServiceWorker to register, which must use https protocol.

attributes.name: data-iframe-src
attributes.description: The URL of an HTML document that installs a ServiceWorker. The URL must use https protocol. This attribute is necessary if the AMP page is going to be served from an AMP Cache.

attributes.name: data-scope
attributes.description: The scope of the service worker to be installed.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Must have the value nodisplay.

attributes.name: data-no-service-worker-fallback-url-match
attributes.description: The is a regular expression that matches URLs to be rewritten to navigate via shell for no-service-worker fallback. See Shell URL rewrite section for more details. The value must be a valid JavaScript RegExp string.

attributes.name: data-no-service-worker-fallback-shell-url
attributes.description: The URL to the shell to use to rewrite URL navigations for no-service-worker fallback. See Shell URL rewrite section for more details. The value must be an URL on the same origin as the AMP document itself.

tags.name: amp-izlesene

attributes.description: The ID of the Izlesene video, which can be found in the Izlesene video page URL.

attributes.description: This is an optional attribute that indicates whether to show related content. This functionality is not available for iOS devices.

attributes.name: data-param-showreplay
attributes.description: This is an optional attribute that indicates whether to show the replay button at the end of the content.

tags.name: amp-jwplayer
tags.description: Displays a cloud-hosted JW Player.

attributes.name: data-player-id
attributes.description: JW Platform player id. This is an 8-digit alphanumeric sequence that can be found in the Players section in your JW Player Dashboard.

attributes.name: data-media-id
attributes.description: The JW Platform media id. This is an 8-digit alphanumeric sequence that can be found in the Content section in your JW Player Dashboard.

attributes.name: data-playlist-id
attributes.description: The JW Platform playlist id. This is an 8-digit alphanumeric sequence that can be found in the Playlists section in your JW Player Dashboard.

attributes.name: data-content-search
attributes.description: Denotes the type of the playlist. If contextual article matching is desired, use the value `__CONTEXTUAL__`.

attributes.name: data-content-backfill
attributes.description: Ensures that a search or contextual playlist always returns a result. If there are no relevant results for the given query, this parameter ensures that a list of trending videos are served instead.

attributes.name: data-player-querystring
attributes.description: A querystring of parameters that will be added to the player iframe src. This can be used for things like token signing.

attributes.name: data-player-param-*
attributes.description: An attribute that will be added as a query parameter to the player iframe src.

attributes.name: data-ad-cust-params
attributes.description: A JSON string of custom parameters to add to ad tags.

attributes.name: data-ad-macro-*
attributes.description: An attribute used to override the default value of macros in ad tags.

attributes.name: data-config-plugin-url
attributes.description: A url string used to pass external JS plugins to the player.

attributes.name: data-config-skin-url
attributes.description: A url string used to pass external CSS skins to the player. See JW Player's CSS Skin Reference for more information.

attributes.name: data-config-json
attributes.description: A JSON string of a player config. This can be used to set specific configuration properties on the player.

attributes.name: data-block-on-consent
attributes.description: Requires amp-consent extension. If this attribute is present, player loading will be delayed until the consent state is resolved.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: If this attribute is present, and the browser supports autoplay, the video will be automatically played as soon as it becomes visible.

attributes.name: dock
attributes.description: Requires amp-video-docking extension.

attributes.name: data-uiconf
attributes.description: The Kaltura player id - uiconf id.

attributes.name: data-entryid
attributes.description: The Kaltura entry id.

attributes.name: data-param-*
attributes.description: All data-param-* attributes will be added as query parameter to the player iframe src.

tags.name: amp-lightbox
tags.description: Displays elements in a full-viewport “lightbox” modal.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: A unique identifier for the lightbox.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Must be set to nodisplay.

attributes.name: animate-in
attributes.description: Defines the style of animation for opening the lightbox. By default, this will be set to fade-in. Valid values are fade-in, fly-in-bottom, and fly-in-top.

tags.name: amp-list
tags.description: Dynamically downloads data and creates list items using a template.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: If fetching the data at the src URL fails, the <amp-list> triggers a low-trust fetch-error event.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: Defines the expression to locate the array to be rendered within the response. This is a dot-notated expression that navigates via fields of the JSON response. By defaut <amp-list> expects an array, the single-item attribute may be used to load data from an object.

attributes.name: max-items
attributes.description: An integer value specifying the maximum length of the items array to be rendered. The items array will be truncated to max-items entries if the returned value exceeds max-items.

attributes.name: single-item
attributes.description: Causes <amp-list> to treat the returned result as if it were a single element array. An object response will be wrapped in an array so {items: {...}} will behave as if it were {items: [{...}]}.

attributes.name: binding
attributes.description: For pages using <amp-list> that also use amp-bind, controls whether or not to block render on the evaluation of bindings (e.g. [text]) in rendered children.

tags.name: amp-live-list
tags.description: Provides a way to display and update content live.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: To uniquely identify an amp-live-list (since multiple are allowed on a single page).

attributes.name: data-poll-interval
attributes.description: Time (in milliseconds) interval between checks for new content (15000 ms minimum is enforced). If no data-poll-interval is provided it will default to the 15000 ms minimum.

attributes.name: data-max-items-per-page
attributes.description: Maximum number of child entries. Additional elements are assumed to be on the next 'page'.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: No polling will occur. Recommended when not on page 1 (looking at archival data) and when the article is no longer fresh and should no longer be updated.

tags.name: amp-megaphone
tags.description: Displays a Megaphone.fm podcast episode or playlist.

attributes.name: data-episode
attributes.description: This attribute is required if data-playlist is not defined.

attributes.name: data-playlist
attributes.description: This attribute is required if data-episode is not defined.

attributes.name: data-start
attributes.description: (for episodes only) The time at which to start the episode in seconds.

attributes.name: data-episodes
attributes.description: (for playlists only) Limits the number of episodes to display.

attributes.name: data-tile
attributes.description: (for episodes only) If present, displays the player in a 'tile' mode where the internal components are layed out vertically.

attributes.name: data-light
attributes.description: If present, this will switch the player theme to the 'light' scheme as opposed to the default dark version.

attributes.name: data-sharing
attributes.description: If present, this will enable the social sharing button on the embedded player. The default value is to disable the button.

attributes.name: width and height
attributes.description: The layout for amp-megaphone is set to fixed-height and it fills all of the available horizontal space. This is ideal for the 'classic' mode, but for 'tile' mode, it's recommended that the height is 455px, and the width is 275px, as per the Megaphone embed code.

tags.name: amp-minute-media-player

attributes.name: data-content-type
attributes.description: The Minute Media player type.

attributes.name: data-content-id
attributes.description: The Minute Media player id.

attributes.name: data-scanned-element-type
attributes.description: Choose the defining characteristic (class-name, tag-name or id) when pairing content with the video.

attributes.name: data-scanned-element
attributes.description: Choose the specific element accoring to the choosen scanned element type to be considered when pairing content with the video.

attributes.name: data-tags
attributes.description: Tags that taken into consideration when the decision which video content to play is made (in 'semantic' content type).

attributes.name: data-minimum-date-factor
attributes.description: This data reflects the last number of days the engine should take into consideration when searching for a matching video. Older videos will receive a lower score

attributes.name: data-scoped-keywords
attributes.description: This data is responsible to return only videos with the specified tags in the matching results.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: If this attribute is present, and the browser supports autoplay

attributes.name: dock
attributes.description: If this attribute is present and the video is playing manually, the video will be 'minimized' and fixed to a corner when the user scrolls out of the video component's visual area.

tags.name: amp-next-page

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The src attribute points to the remote endpoint that returns amp-next-page's JSON configuration. This must be A CORS HTTP service. The URL's protocol must be HTTPS.

attributes.name: max-pages
attributes.description: The maximum number of pages to load and show to the user. The maximum number should be less than the total amount of pages. After meeting the number, <amp-next-page> displays the recommendation box. The default is Infinity.

attributes.name: deep-parsing
attributes.description: The deep-parsing attribute enables recursive parsing of subsequently loaded documents's <amp-next-page> JSON configurations.

attributes.name: xssi-prefix
attributes.description: When specified, this attribute enables amp-next-page to strip a prefix before parsing remotely hosted JSON. This can be useful for APIs that include security prefixes like )]} to help prevent cross site scripting attacks.

attributes.description: Specifies a default zoom scale, which should be a positive number from 1 - 9. The default value is 1.

attributes.name: initial-x, initial-y
attributes.description: Specifies default translation coordinates, otherwise both are set to 0. The value is expected to be a whole number.

attributes.name: reset-on-resize

attributes.name: controls

tags.name: amp-pixel

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: A simple URL to a remote endpoint that must be https protocol.

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: This attribute is similar to the referrerpolicy attribute on , however no-referrer is the only accepted value. If referrerpolicy=no-referrer is specified, the referrer header is removed from the HTTP request.

attributes.name: allow-ssr-img
attributes.description: This attribute used in AMP4ADS creatives indicates that as part of post validation transformation, an img element may be placed directly within the amp-pixel element allowing the ping to be sent in parallel with AMP runtime fetch/execution. Note that it means that any macros within the url will NOT be expanded so only use if they are not present in the src.

tags.name: amp-position-observer
tags.description: Monitors the position of an element within the viewport as a user scrolls, and dispatches events that can be used with other AMP components.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Specifies the ID of the element to observe. If not specified, the parent< of <amp-position-observer> is used as the target.

attributes.description: Defines how much of the target should be visible in the viewport before <amp-position-observer> triggers any of its events. The value is a number between 0 and 1 (default is 0).

attributes.name: viewport-margins
attributes.description: A px or vh value which can be used to shrink the area of the viewport used for visibility calculations. A number without a unit will be assumed px. Defaults to 0.

attributes.name: once
attributes.description: Only triggers the enter and exit events once. The scroll event will also only perform one iteration.

attributes.description: Same as controlsList attribute of HTML5 video element. Only supported by certain browsers.

attributes.description: Requires amp-video-docking component. If this attribute is present and the video is playing manually, the video will be 'minimized' and fixed to a corner or an element when the user scrolls out of the video component's visual area.

attributes.name: rotate-to-fullscreen
attributes.description: If the video is visible, the video displays fullscreen after the user rotates their device into landscape mode. For more details, see the Video in AMP spec.

attributes.description: Specifies a URL to a PNG/JPG/ICO image serving as the video's artwork. If artwork is not present, the Media Session API helper uses either the image field in the schema.org definition, the og:image, or the website's favicon.

globalAttributes.description: Timestamp used for sorting entries. Higher timestamps will be inserted before older entries.

globalAttributes.name: data-update-time
globalAttributes.description: Timestamp when the entry was last updated. Use this attribute to trigger an update on an existing item: the client will replace all existing content in this item with the new, updated content, without triggering the appearance of the update reference point.

globalAttributes.name: data-tombstone
globalAttributes.description: If present, the entry is assumed to be deleted.

globalAttributes.name: sort
globalAttributes.description: If present and has a value of 'ascending' (any other value is currently invalid), newer items will be inserted at the bottom of the live-list instead of the top.

globalAttributes.name: min-visible-count
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1. Determines the minimum number of slides that should be shown at a given time. Fractional values can be used to make part of a(n) additional slide(s) visible.

globalAttributes.name: max-visible-count
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE. Determines the maximum number of slides that should be shown at a given time. Fractional values can be used to make part of a(n) additional slide(s) visible.

globalAttributes.name: min-item-width
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1. Determines the minimum width of each item, used to resolve how many whole items can be shown at once within the overall width of the gallery.

globalAttributes.name: max-item-width
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE. Determines the maximum width of each item, used to resolve how many whole items can be shown at once within the overall width of the gallery.

globalAttributes.name: slide-align
globalAttributes.description: Either start or center. When start aligning, the start of a slide (e.g. the left edge, when horizontal aligning) is aligned with the start of a carousel. When center aligning, the center of a slide is aligned with the center of a carousel.

globalAttributes.name: snap
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to true. Determines whether or not the carousel should snap on slides when scrolling.

globalAttributes.name: mixed-length
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to false.

globalAttributes.name: visible-count
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1.

globalAttributes.name: advance-count
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1. Determines how many slides the carousel will advance when advancing using the previous or next arrows. This is useful when specifying the visible-count attribute.

globalAttributes.name: auto-advance
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to false. Automatically advances the carousel to the next slide based on a delay. If the user manually changes slides, then the auto advance is stopped. Note that if loop is not enabled, when reaching the last item, the auto advance will move backwards to the first item.

globalAttributes.name: auto-advance-count
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1. Determines how many slides the carousel will advance when automatically advancing. This is useful when specifying the visible-count attribute.

globalAttributes.name: auto-advance-interval
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1000. Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, between subsequent automatic advances of the carousel.

globalAttributes.name: auto-advance-loops
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to ∞. The number of times the carousel should advance through the slides before stopping.

globalAttributes.name: snap
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to true. Determines whether or not the carousel should snap on slides when scrolling.

globalAttributes.name: snap-align
globalAttributes.description: Either start or center. When start aligning, the start of a slide (e.g. the left edge, when horizontal aligning) is aligned with the start of a carousel. When center aligning, the center of a slide is aligned with the center of a carousel.

globalAttributes.name: snap-by
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 1. This determines the granularity of snapping and is useful when using visible-count. This

globalAttributes.name: controls
globalAttributes.description: Either 'always', 'auto', or 'never', defaults to 'auto'. This determines if and when prev/next navigational arrows are displayed. Note: When outset-arrows is true, the arrows are shown 'always'.

values.name: auto
values.description: Arrows are displayed when the carousel has most recently received interaction via mouse, and not displayed when the carousel has most recently received interaction via touch.

globalAttributes.name: slide
globalAttributes.description: A number, defaults to 0. This determines the initial slide shown in the carousel. This may be used with amp-bind to control which slide is currently showing.

globalAttributes.name: loop
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to false when omitted. When true, the carousel will allow the user to move from the first item back to the last item and visa versa. There must be at least three times the visible-count of slides present for looping to occur.

globalAttributes.name: horizontal
globalAttributes.description: Either true or false, defaults to true. When true the carousel will lay out horizontally, with the user being able to swipe left and right. When false, the carousel lays out vertically, with the user being able to swipe up and down.

globalAttributes.name: fallback
globalAttributes.description: A fallback is displayed when the browser does not support the element or when loading the underlying resource failed.

globalAttributes.name: heights
globalAttributes.description: All AMP elements that support the responsive layout, also support the heights attribute.

globalAttributes.name: layout
globalAttributes.description: AMP provides a set of layouts that specify how an AMP component behaves in the document layout.

globalAttributes.name: media
globalAttributes.description: Most AMP elements support the media attribute. The value of media is a media query.

globalAttributes.name: noloading
globalAttributes.description: The noloading attribute indicates whether the 'loading indicator' should be turned off for this element.

globalAttributes.name: on
globalAttributes.description: The on attribute is used to install event handlers on elements. The events that are supported depend on the element.

globalAttributes.name: placeholder
globalAttributes.description: The placeholder attribute indicates that the element marked with this attribute acts as a placeholder for the parent AMP element.

globalAttributes.name: sizes
globalAttributes.description: All AMP elements that support the responsive layout, also support the sizes attribute.

globalAttributes.name: width
globalAttributes.description: For some layouts, AMP components must have a width and height attribute that contains an integer pixel value.

globalAttributes.name: height
globalAttributes.description: For some layouts, AMP components must have a width and height attribute that contains an integer pixel value.
